main event: On 13 March 1949, an unidentified lighted flying object was observed at Sandia Base, AEC, Tech. Area by two military personnel.
interesting points: The object was described as a bell with a tail of fire, about half the size of a full moon, and of blue or greenish white color with a white center.
It was observed to be slower than a falling star and was moving in a descending path in the northeast horizon beyond the range of Sandia Mountains.
No maneuverability or sound was observed, and the object left behind a flaming trail approximately twice the length of its body.
The observation lasted for 2 to 4 seconds in clear sky and moderate moonlight.
Thorough investigation was requested of all personnel at Sandia Base.
sighted object: unidentified lighted flying object shaped like a bell with a tail of fire
location: Sandia Base, AEC, Tech. Area, New Mexico
